words.description: A round fruit that is typically red, green, or yellow and is commonly eaten fresh or used in various recipes.
A spherical object used in various sports and games, typically made of rubber, leather, or plastic.
A small domesticated carnivorous mammal with soft fur, a short snout, and retractable claws.
A domesticated carnivorous mammal that is commonly kept as a pet or used for various purposes.
The oval reproductive body laid by female birds, reptiles, fish, and some other animals, containing the developing embryo.
A limbless cold-blooded vertebrate animal with gills and fins, living wholly in water.
An activity or sport involving competition, skill, or chance, often undertaken for entertainment or enjoyment.
A covering for the head, typically with a shaped crown and brim, worn for protection, fashion, or ceremony.
The solid form of water, formed by freezing below 0 degrees Celsius (32 degrees Fahrenheit).
A sweet spread or preserve made from fruit and sugar boiled to a thick consistency.
A small metal or plastic device used to open locks or operate machinery.
A large, powerful cat with a tawny coat, known for its majestic appearance and loud roar.
The natural satellite of the Earth, which orbits around it and reflects sunlight to appear as a shining disk in the night sky.
A structure built by birds or other animals to house and protect their eggs or young.
A citrus fruit with a bright orange color and a sweet, tangy flavor.
A domesticated mammal with a stout body, short legs, and a snout used for rooting in the soil.
A female ruler or the wife or widow of a king.
A flowering shrub or vine with typically thorny stems and fragrant flowers in various colors.
The star at the center of the solar system, around which the Earth and other planets revolve, providing heat and light.
A tall woody perennial plant with a single main trunk and many branches, typically bearing leaves or needles and producing seeds or fruits.
A portable device consisting of a collapsible canopy supported by a metal frame, used for protection against rain or sunlight.
A stringed musical instrument played with a bow, typically having four strings and a hollow wooden body.
A very large marine mammal with a streamlined body, a horizontal tail fin, and a blowhole on top of the head.
A musical instrument consisting of a row of wooden bars of different lengths that are struck with mallets to produce musical tones.
A semi-solid dairy product made by fermenting milk with live bacteria cultures, often eaten as a healthy snack or used in cooking.
